intro: Hieracium epimedium subsp. pseudoviride, commonly known as the greenleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of broadly ovate, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
